Pros: Excellent performance
Good set of cameras on both sides
Has support for wireless and fast charging

Overview: The ZenFone 3 Deluxe is company’s first smartphone to be powered by the latest Snapdragon 821 processor. Currently, there are only two other smartphones are available in India which are powered by this processor i.e OnePlus 3T and Google Pixel. However, ZenFone 3 Deluxe is available in two variants – one with 64GB of inbuilt storage and powered by Snapdragon 820 whereas the higher variant comes with 256GB of inbuilt storage and powered by Snapdragon 821. Both the variants feature a whopping 6GB of RAM.

The HTC One mini is what HTC claims to be, the miniaturised version of the HTC One, without too much compromise. On the exterior, it sure does seem so  as the One mini retains the same unibody aluminum enclosure that people love on the HTC One. The screen is smaller at 4.3-inches, thereby reducing the width of the handset and to make one-handed operation easier. The resolution is dropped down from Full HD to 1280 x 720 pixels, but owing to the smaller screen size, the handset still has a pretty sharp screen. The chipset is also a dual-core Snapdragon 400 running at 1.4GHz, unlike the quad-core chip powering the big brother. The RAM is halved to 1GB, internal memory too is cut by half to 16GB, also without any microSD card slot for expansion.

The HTC One mini has high-speed Internet connectivity in the form of 4G LTE support, along with WiFi and 3G. Missing in the connectivity department are NFC and the Infrared port, which are available on the One. In the camera department, the One mini retains the 4 UltraPixel camera of its sibling, but loses the Optical Image Stabilization. Nonetheless, it can record 1080p HD videos at a smooth frame rate. There's a 1.6MP front-facing camera for video-calls too. The One mini has a smaller 1800 mAh battery, but considering the comparatively lower resolution screen and chipset, it should hopefully suffice.

The Samsung Galaxy Golden is an Android-based smartphone with a flip form factor that's almost not to be seen these days. But the word 'Golden' in the name indicates the golden finish on the sides of the phone. It fuses two similarly sized 3.7-inch Super AMOLED displays back-to-back with a traditional numeric keypad. They have a reasonable 800 x 480 pixel resolution, and thanks to a 'hidden receiver', one can make calls even with the flip closed. Being a touchscreen phone, we also assume the phone would be entirely operational without having to open the flip. Samsung has created the flip to cater to the niche audience who misses the form factor and also prefers using buttons while dialling a phone number. Other than this, it's pretty much a mid-range smartphone on the inside  a dual-core 1.7GHz Snapdragon 400 chipset, 1.5GB RAM, 16GB internal storage.

At the back you've got an 8 megapixel shooter and a 1.9MP cam for video calls/selfies. The 1820 mAh battery inside sounds a little less given the mid-range specs; but looking at the relatively low resolution display, hopefully the phone gets by the entire day on a single charge. Samsung is targeting the premium audience for this phone; with a price tag of Rs. 51,900 at launch.

Since the time immemorial, HTC has been known to make beautiful phones. Even before the HTC M7, which is looked upon as the trendsetter as far as the modern day smartphone design goes, the likes of HTC Tilt Pro 2, Desire or even the HTC Desire HD were finely built phones. After the HTC One M9, what had been widely reported as a failure, the HTC 10 has been seen as a sort of a comeback by HTC in the game. The phone brings the now synonymous with HTC, a metallic unibody design with chamfered edges. The other hardware features of the phone includes:

1. Does it feature a fingerprint sensor?: 3. Does the phone have a Hybrid SIM slot?
6. What’s the PPI of the display?:

Ans: It comes with Android 6.0 Marshmallow and will receive the Android 7.0 Nougat update in December 2016.

8. What type or charging connector do I need? 
Ans: It sports a USB Type-C charging connector.

Pros: Beautiful design and build quality
HTC has cut down on a ton of bloatware
Very well calibrated display. Colors look natural and have a good punch
First smartphone to come with OIS for front facing camera
First Android phone to support AirPlay out of the box
Cons: Phone can feel a little slippery

Introduction:: The Vivo Xplay5 Elite, from Vivo Electronics Corp, was launched in March 2016. It is a dual SIM smartphone, which supports the 4G band on both the SIMs, high speed latest processor and has a very largest internal storage in the comparative price range of smart phones.
Display and Design:: The Vivo has a curved QHD display with a screen size of 5.43 inch. It has a touchscreen resolution of 1440 x 2560 pixels. The gadget measures 153.50 x 76.20 x 7.59 mm and weighs 167.80 grams. It is available in Gold color.
Hardware and Features:: The Vivo Elite has a strong 2.15GHz quad-core processor that is of Qualcomm Snapdragon 820 make. It has an Android 6.0 OS. It has a proximity sensor, accelerometer, ambient light sensor and gyroscope. It also has a Funtouch OS 2.6 which is a unique feature giving a smooth and fluid experience with customization of its OS.
Camera and Storage:: It is equipped with a 16MP rear camera and a flash. It has an 8MP front camera that allows users to click selfies. This dual SIM smartphone has a vast internal storage capacity of 128GB, is not expandable and has a 6GB RAM.
Battery and Connectivity:: The Vivo Xplay5 Elite has a removable 3600mAh battery. It offers Wi-Fi connectivity, with 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac and GPS navigation. Both SIMs support 4G services of band 40 in India.
Competition:: The Vivo Elite can be compared to the

Overview: The Vivo Xplay 6 will likely be the flagship offering and the internals are definitely top spec. It features a Quad HD resolution screen and is powered by the Snapdragon 821 processor which is also powering the Pixel smartphones. The same chip is expected to power the upcoming OnePlus 3T as well.

OnePlus has launched it’s next level flagship phone the OnePlus 6. The phone comes with improvements in certain areas as compared to its predecessor. Let’s find out what this new device offers out of the box:
Display & Design:: Beginning with the display the OnePlus 6 rocks a large 6.28-inch AMOLED  bezel-less display. It bears a Full HD+ resolution of 2280 x 1080 pixels which translates to a 402PPI pixel density producing a sharp and crisp display. Design-wise, the OnePlus 6 looks different than all of its previous versions. This is due to the notch located on the top of display. The phone rocks an all glass body. A Corning Gorilla Glass is fitted on the top of the screen as well as the back to ensure protection against accidental damage & scratches. There is a USB Type-C connector for charging and transferring data. The phone retains a 3.5 mm headphone jack for connecting any audio accessories. On the flip side, the dual rear cameras are now vertically aligned along with the fingerprint sensor mounted below. Both are located in the middle.
Camera:: In the photography department, the OnePlus 6 is not much different than the previous OnePlus 5T. It sports a dual rear camera comprising of a 16MP primary sensor assisted by a 20MP secondary sensor. It has an aperture of f/1.7 and is accompanied by a dual LED flash for better pictures in low light. The primary rear camera now offers Optical Image Stabilisation (OIS) along with Electronic Image Stabilisation (EIS). Upfront, there is a 16MP snapper with f/2.0 aperture for clicking selfies. The rear camera is capable of recording 4k videos.
Performance, Storage & OS:: On the performance front, the OnePlus 6 stays up to its tagline ‘The speed you need’. Under the hood, it houses a 2.8GHz Qualcomm’s flagship Snapdragon 845 octa-core chipset. It is coupled with 8GB RAM and and Adreno 630 graphics processor onboard. The aforementioned hardware ensures seamless multitasking and lag-free gaming performance. As for storage, this device offers 128GB internal memory. It can’t be expanded as it lacks a microSD card slot. Like all the OnePlus phones, this one runs on custom Oxygen OS as well, it is layered on the top of Android 8.0 Oreo OS. OnePlus has added a feature where you can hide the notch if you don’t like it.
Battery & Connectivity:: The OnePlus 6 is powered by a 3300 mAh non-removable battery which is the same as seen on OnePlus 5T. There is support for fast charging on the phone. It functions as a dual SIM smartphone and supports Nano SIM cards. For networking, all the basic connectivity options like 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth, NFC and VoLTE are included.

Overview: The Galaxy Note 3 is the 2013 iteration of the highly popular 'Note' series of Phablets pioneered by Samsung. It is a successor to the Note 2; and brings evolutionary changes to the table. Starting with the dimensions, it has the same footprint but is a millimeter thinner and noticeably lighter. The back of the device has a stitched leather finish, which is unique. But despite the same footprint, the Note 3 manages to fit in a slightly larger 5.7-inch display. The resolution is now bumped up to 1920 x 1080 pixels, a.k.a Full HD. The screen is of the Super AMOLED variety. The processor is bumped up to a Quad-core 2.3GHz (LTE) or 1.9GHz (3G) depending upon the variant your country has. In India, the chipset will mostly be the latter, which has two separate quad-core chips that switch depending upon usage. The RAM is also upped to 3GB, which possibly is the highest in a smartphone today. Internal memory starts at a capacious 32GB, with a microSD card slot for further expansion. All possible forms of modern-day networking supports are available  LTE, 3G, WiFi, Bluetooth 4.0, NFC etc. Speaking of connectivity, the Note 3 is also the first phone to feature USB 3.0 support, which will enable high-speed data transfers from computer to phone.

In the camera department, it gets the 13 megapixel sensor like the Galaxy S4, but yet another never-before-seen feature is the support for 4K resolution recording. Unfortunately, only the LTE version of the Note 3 has this feature; the ones sold in India, that are powered by Samsung's Exynos processor, can shoot only up to 1080p HD. The front-facing 2MP camera can do 1080p HD recording too. There are a plethora of software features that Samsung has added to the Note 3 that enhances the active stylus functionality we've experienced with the previous Note handsets (watch the video above to check them out). Powering all these features is a slightly larger 3200 mAh battery inside.

The Oneplus 6T McLaren Edition is an upgrade to the previously launched OnePlus 6T in Nov 2018. The device comes with improvements in a few aspects. Let’s delve into the technical specifications below:
Display & Design:: The Oneplus 6T McLaren Edition sports the same 6.41-inch optic AMOLED display as seen on its predecessor. The display translates to 402 PPI pixel density producing crisp and bright output. A Corning Gorilla Glass 6 is fitted on the top for protection against accidental damage and scratches. Design-wise, the 6T features a tiny waterdrop notch on the top of the display. The front and rear sides are flanked by glass panels that give a premium look. The device has an in-display fingerprint scanner instead of a physical scanner mounted on the rear. It is IP53 rated dust and splash resistant.
Camera:: In the photography department, the OnePlus 6T is equipped with a vertical dual camera setup comprising of 16MP primary and 20MP secondary camera. Both feature a Sony sensor with f/1.7 aperture. Upfront, there is a 16MP shooter with f/2.0 for clicking selfies. The camera features EIS and OIS for clicking better pictures. OnePlus has added various camera features in the software like HDR, ISO, white balance and Bokeh mode. The device offers 4K video recording.
Performance, Storage & OS:: In terms of performance, the 6T is quite similar to its predecessor. The device is powered by a Snapdragon 845 processor. It is coupled with 10GB RAM and Adreno 630 GPU onboard. The device offers 256GB internal memory without support for SDcard slot for further expansion. On the software front, the Oneplut 6T McLaren Edition runs on the latest Android 9.0 Pie based Oxygen OS.
Battery & Connectivity:: The Oneplus 6T McLaren Edition is fitted with a 3,700 mAh battery more than the OnePlus 6. It supports fast charging capabilities. The device has a USB Type-C port for charging and headphone jack for connecting audio accessories. Connectivity-wise, all the basic options like 4G LTE, 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and NFC are included.

Overview: Sony is known to make phones with good build quality and great designs. The Sony Z3 Compact is a successor to the Z1 Compact as the Z2 never had a mini version. Somewhere Sony is the company that has made better compact phones than others. The phone has a 4.6inches display as compared to the 4.3inches one on the Z1 compact but still has the same resolution of 1280x720 pixels which takes the pixel density down to 320PPI.

The other upgrade is that it comes with a Snapdragon 801 unlike the Snapdragon 800 in the Z1 Compact. It has a bigger battery ie. 2600mAh but somehow still manages to be lighter than its predecessor. The phone comes with 2GB RAM and memory can be expanded upto 128GB using a microSD card. When it comes to the camera, this phone like other Sonys Z series has aced this feature. It has a 20.7MP rear camera which has features like panorama, geo-tagging, touch focus, face and smile recognition,etc. The phone will be available in four different colours and will directly compete with the HTC One Mini and the Samsung Galaxy S5 Mini.

Pros: Blazing fast performance
Dash charge ensures very fast charging
Simple and bloat-free operating system
Quick and accurate fingerprint sensor
Cons: Dual Camera setup could have been better

Overview: The Nokia Lumia 930 is the flagship that was announced with Microsofts huge Windows Phone 8.1 update. This phone has a fair number of upgrades from its predecessor or sorts, the Lumia 925. In fact, it is a smaller version of the high-end Lumia 1520 phablet. The Lumia 930 sports a 5.0-inch 1920 x 1080 pixel, which is bigger and more pixel dense than the Lumia 925. The internals have also been beefed up  a Qualcomm Snapdragon 800 quad-core 2.2GHz chip now roars away, with 2GB of RAM and 32GB of internal storage (theres no microSD card slot, but this much should be sufficient for most).

The camera system is also bumped up to a 20MP rear sensor with optical image stabilization and a dual-LED flash. It can also capture 1080p HD videos with stereo sound. Theres a typical 1.2MP front-facing camera, which in todays day and age seems inadequate for taking high-quality selfies. It also has built-in Wireless charging that was left out in the Lumia 925. All this high-end hardware is powered by a 2420mAh battery.

The HTC Radar was launched in October 2011. It runs on Windows Phone 7.5 (Mango) platform. It has a 3.8 inch capacitive touch screen. It has 512MB RAM, and 8GB of internal memory, a 5MP rear camera and a VGA secondary camera that supports HD video recording. Cloud services & social networks like Facebook, Twitter, Skydrive and Windows Live are integrated. It also supports GPS and provides access to Bing Maps.

The Sony XPERIA Z1 was criticised for having a mediocre display for a high-end smartphone. This is addressed in the XPERIA Z2, which has a noticeably better display fitting to its stature of a flagship phone. It's still the same 1080p resolution on a slightly larger 5.2-inch display size. It is powered by the latest Snapdragon 801 quad-core 2.3GHz chip much like the Samsung Galaxy S5. But comes with an ampler 3GB of RAM (the Z1 had 2GB).

It still has the 20.7MP rear camera that Sony's really proud of, and now it does 4K video recording too. Also, like the iPhone 5s the phone can record slo-mo video at 120fps. To top it off, it now has stereo speakers too. Also, the XPERIA Z2 is still water/dust resistant like its predecessors. The battery size is also bumped a little to 3200mAh. All in all, the XPERIA Z2 keeps all the good things about the Z1, while adding some much-needed improvements and feature-additions to keep the lineup up to date with modern times.

The Micromax Canvas Fun A76 is similar to the Canvas Fun A74 which also sells as part of the colourful 'Fun' series of handsets from the Indian phone maker. It comes in the same three youthful shades  Red, Black and Blue. The A76 has a bigger 5-inch screen, but with the same 854 x 480 pixels, which in effect would reduce the pixel density. Interestingly, the processor is also a tad slower at 1.2GHz as compared to 1.3GHz on the A74. Rest of the details are about the same  4GB internal memory, 512MB RAM, a 5 megapixel fixed focus camera. One thing substantially bigger on the A76, other than its display, is the 2000mAh rated battery (the A74 has a 1500mAh one). Connectivity options include WiFi, 3G and Bluetooth 2.0. It runs Android 4.2 Jelly Bean out of the box.

The HTC One Dual SIM, as the name suggests, is the variant that supports two SIM cards. It is the flagship model from the Taiwanese company for the year 2013. This handset encompasses HTC's best effort  and therefore the Matrix-inspired name, "The One". It's a stunning handset to look at, with its unibody aluminium body. The display is a 4.7-inch, Super LCD3 type with 1920 x 1080 resolution which translates to a whopping 496 PPI. Above and below that brilliant display are stereo speakers that belt out loud output with good clarity. Its more than adequately powered by the quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 600 chipset and an ample 2GB RAM. It comes in 32GB and 64GB capacities. The phone supports 4G LTE as well as WiFi's latest standard; 802.11ac. In the camera department, HTC's doing things differently. Enter UltraPixel  the sensor at the back of the HTC One can shoot only 4 megapixels, but the size of individual pixels in the sensor is twice the size found in good camera-phones like the iPhone 5 or 808 PureView. This, coupled with OIS (Optical Image Stabilisation), should give better low-light photography than typical camera-phones. There's also a 2.1MP front-facing camera with HDR support. Lastly, a 2300 mAh battery fit into the casing powers this beast of a handset.

OnePlus has added a feature where you can hide the notch if you don’t like it.
