Overview: OPPO's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM might actually be one of the cheapest 5G devices of all time. This 5G device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a beautiful AMOLED display, a huge 5000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 700 MT6833 Octa core SoC.
Design and Display: The OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM will reportedly boast a 6.52 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 269ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive Waterdrop notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 and a screen to body ratio of 88.7% for enhanced viewing experience. The display will arrive with a refresh rate of 60Hz.
Cameras: The OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM is expected to house a triple rear camera with a 13MP wide-angle primary sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 8MP wide-angle selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeAF Phase Detection, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM will be baked with the MediaTek Dimensity 700 MT6833 Octa core chipset coupled with an Mali-G57 MC2GPU. The device will come assembled with 8GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 128 GB, which can be expanded upto a whopping 1TB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 5000mAh Li-ion battery .
Software and Connectivity: OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM will run ColorOS UI on top of Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features like 5G, dual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.0. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and a side-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Ahead of IPL 2017, Vivo introduced the limited edition of the V5 Plus. The biggest attraction, it comes with a humongous 20MP camera up front alongside an 8MP secondary camera for capturing selfies. Below that, 1920 x 1080 pixels stretched across a 5.5-inch display result in 401 PPI pixel density. The display further comes protected with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection with 2.5D curved glass on top.

The HTC Desire X is a lower mid-range handset by the Taiwanese phone maker. It's got a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel Super LCD display, a dual-core 1GHz processor and 768MB of RAM. There's 4GB of internal memory, assumingly around half of which should be available to the user. There's a microSD card slot to expand further. The Desire X is a 3G-enabled handset with speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. It also has Bluetooth 4.0 support as well. The 5 megapixel autofocus sensor at the back can shoot videos in a non-HD 480p resolution (a.k.a DVD resolution, presumably due to the low-end Adreno 203 graphics chip. It runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean with HTC's Sense UI 4. Powering this device is a 1650 mAh Lithium ion battery. The Desire X has now been discontinued, and replaced with the Desire X Dual SIM, which is essentially the same handset but with two SIM card slots.

Samsung Grand series have been highly successful since its launch a couple of years back. With the Galaxy Grand Max it aims to cash in on the already popular Grand series and bring a different phone to the masses. The phone is available in two colours: Grey & White.
The features of the Samsung Galaxy Grand Max are as follows
5.25 Inch display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels
1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 Processor with 1.5GB of RAM
16GB Internal storage for apps and user data
MicroSD card supports cards upto 64GB
13 Megapixel Autofocus camera with LED Flash
5 Megapixel front facing wide angle camera
Samsung TouchWiz UI on top of Android 4.4 Kitkat
2500mAh Battery
Dual SIM
Alternatives
HTC Desire 816G
Micromax Canvas 4 Plus
Micromax Canvas Nitro

Intro:: Le 2 Pro 64GB launched in April, 2016. This device has an maximum internal memory of 64GB. The primary camera of the phone is 21MP. It is built with CDLA (Continual Digital Lossless Audio) technology due to which users will get loss-less experience of finest quality audio.
Display and Design:: The dimension of this device is
Hardware & Features:: The Le 2 Pro 64GB has a chipset of MediaTek MT6797T Helio X25 and a processor of Deca-core (2x2.5GHz Cortex-A72, 4x2GHz Cortex-A53, 4x1.4GHz Cortex-A53). The inbuilt OS of the device is Android 6.0 version (Marshmallow).
Camera & Storage:: The Le 2 Pro 64GB has a primary camera of 21MP and the secondary camera of 8MP available with a LED flash light. The internal storage is 64GB with no extra slot of external memory card. The users can watch Full HD 1080p video in fine quality.
Battery & Connectivity:: The Le 2 Pro 64GB has a non-removable battery of 3000mAh which provides a great amount of battery backup and stand by features and it also supports fast charging. The device has both 4G and 3G features and Wi-Fi functionalities.
Competition: This mobile can be considered as an affordable product in this category of mobile phones. Samsung Galaxy A8 has some equivalent specifications when compared to Le 2 Pro.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) About LeEco Le 2 Pro 64GB
1. Will this phone support Reliance Jio network?
2. What type of charging connector do I need?
Ans: This phone comes with the latest USB Type-C port for charging and data syncing.
3. What is the internal storage size available to install apps?
Ans: Out of the 64GB onboard storage, around 52GB is available to the user to install apps and store other data.
4. Is this a good phone for gaming?: Ans: Yes, Le 2 Pro sports good hardware and should run most games without any issues.
5. Will this phone get future software updates of Android?
Ans: LeEco like Xiaomi has never focused on providing Android updates but rather focus on their own eUI to improve performance and feature additions.
6. Does the phone support 4K video recording?
Ans: Yes, the Le 2 Pro has a 21MP rear camera that can shoot videos up to 4K resolution.
7. Does it support USB OTG?: Ans: Yes, apart from the internal storage, this phone also support USB OTG wherein you can transfer and browse the content of your pen drive or a HDD on your phone.
8. Is the battery removable?: Ans: Having a metal unibody construction, the Le 2 Pro's battery is not user removable.

Overview: Xolo X900 is a stylish smartphone running on Android Ice Cream Sandwich by Lava Mobiles. Intel partnered with Lava Mobiles to make an entry in the smartphone market after being rejected by the giants like Samsung, HTC, LG and others. X900 has a 1.6 GHz Intel Atom processor and 1 GB RAM allowing fast web browsing, responsive apps and better multi-tasking. The processor comes with Hyper-Threading technology ensuring the applications get loaded in minimum time. The phone also contains a 400 MHz Graphics Engine providing rich 3D gaming experience with super-responsive graphics. The display on the device is a 4 inch TFT LCD Capacitive touchscreen and screen resolution of 1024 x 600 pixels giving full HD video output.

The phone features an 8 MP camera with burst mode, allowing the users to take up to 10 pictures in less than a second. However, the image quality is not as good as what we would expect with an 8 MP camera. The camera unit has been clubbed with an application allowing filters like Sepia, Black and White, Negative and more. The back camera allows you to capture 1080 p HD videos and the 1.3 MP front camera is capable of recording 720 p videos. One major problem the users might face is the lack of compatibility of the applications present in the play store. Most of the applications are made compatible with ARM chipset and not the Intel chipset.

The Nokia 701 was released in October 2011. The phone has a 3.5 inch Gorilla glass touch screen with ClearBlack technology. It has 512MB RAM, and an 8GB internal memory which is expandable upto 64GB through a provided microSD slot.

It is equipped with an 8MP full focus camera with 3x digital zoom and dual LED flash, and a secondary VGA camera and video recording. It also has a music player with MP3 support and surround sound, and a stereo FM radio with RDS. It also has support for A-GPS, Bluetooth and USB 2.0.

After the Wildfire S, HTC has another Android phone that is priced for the ones with a short budget. The Explorer has a compact size that is convenient as compared to the huge brick-sized phones available nowadays. It runs the same HTC's Sense UI like past Wildfire models atop Android 2.3 Gingerbread. The 3.2" HVGA (320 x 480 pixel) screen is the same as the Wildfire S, but the camera is downgraded from 5 MP auto-focus sensor to a 3MP fixed focus one. The Snapdragon processor on the HTC Explorer is clocked at 600 MHz with 512MB RAM. Internal memory, like its cousin models, is barely sufficient for installing just a few modern day apps. There's a microSD card slot to cater to your media files. The Explorer is also known as the Pico.

Gionee Elife E5 is a launched by Chinese manufacturer Gionee, which is gaining popularity for its high quality phones at affordable prices. This smartphone supports single SIM. The screen size is 4.8 Inch HD Super AMOLED Display with 1280 x 720 pixels resolution. The phone is available in three colors viz. Yellow, Graphite Black and White. The processor used is 1.5GHz quad-core, MediaTek MT6589T chipset with 1GB of RAM memory. The smartphone has an internal storage of 16GB and cannot be expanded further, as theres no microSD card slot. The phone runs on Android OS v4.2 (Jelly Bean). About camera, the rear camera sports 8MP with flashlight, Face Detection, Geo-Tagging, Touch Focus. Also the front facing camera has 5MP clarity and can be used for video calling and taking selfies. Videos can be recorded in 1080p HD quality. Sensors used on the Elife E5 are Magnetometer, Proximity sensor, Accelerometer sensor and Ambient light sensor. The smartphone supports 2G and 3G network as well. Other typical features include WiFi, GPS, Bluetooth and FM radio as well. A Lithium-Ion 2000 mAh Battery is used that is expected to give a reasonable up-time.

With a good design and an amazing camera, the Honor Play is a competitive entry in the Indian smartphone market. With the tagline of ‘Crazy fast, crazy smart’, this is a phone that delivers on all fronts. Here is what you sign up for when you decide to buy the phone:
The design is a thin metallic unibody with a tall display, which is a 6.3-inch full-HD+ IPS LCD panel with a resolution of 1080×2340 pixels and a 19.5:9 aspect ratio.
Like all leading phones today, Honor Play has a dual 16MP and 2MP camera at the rear with assisted dual LED flash. A16MP camera sits at the front.
The phone comes packed with Huawei’s flagship HiSilicon Kirin 970 chipset and a GPU Turbo option technology that delivers amazing performance.
The call quality is improved by a new antenna design. Along with this, the phone has a huge 3750 mAh battery and comes with Huawei’s fast charger to make sure your phone never runs out of juice.
The phone sports Android Oreo 8.1 with a custom skin from Huawei on top of it, known as the EMUI 8.2. Functions such as the one-hand mode, navigation gesture, and themes catalog are included.

Pros: Large screen size with a notch and thin bezels.
Long battery life.
Smart AI camera with Creative features.
Flagship Kirin 970 processor
Cons: A tendency to mildly heat up with extended use.
The camera struggles in low light.

Overview: Xperia T3 is Sonys newest phablet in the market and based on the name it sounds like the successor to the Xperia T2 (but it isnt). Sony has adopted the OmniBalance design philosophy for most of its devices and the Xperia T3 is no exception. The phablets have recently shown a lot of promise in the developing markets and Sony is aiming to capitalize on the situation. Sony took the formula applied to the Xperia T2 and after a bit of changes, enter the Xperia T3.

The Xperia T3 has a lot of similarities when compared to the Xperia T2. The same 1.4 GHz Cortex A7 Quad Core processors along with 1GB of RAM are in charge of the processing. The screen resolution remains the same (at 1280 x 720 pixels) along with the Triluminos display and the Mobile BRAVIA Engine 2. But the Xperia T3 is much smaller at 5.3 inches, thereby making the display sharper; and the dimensions much more handy. The device comes with the same 8GB of internal storage with MicroSD slot for expansion. The camera has been reduced to 8 megapixel sensor as compared to the 13 megapixel on the Xperia T2 with no changes to the front facing camera.

The Xperia T3 comes with Android Kitkat (4.4.2) out of the box with Sony's Customizations. Sony claims it to be the slimmest 5.3 device, packing in a huge screen and components in a slim unibody construction. The battery at 2500 mAh seems like a bit of a compromise to reduce the thickness of the device, but we're guessing should be OK considering the mid-range specs of the device.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) about:
1. Does it support OTG?
Ans: No, it doesn’t support OTG.
2. Does the phone have a Hybrid SIM slot: Ans: No, it has a dedicated slot for MicroSD card up to 32GB.
Ans: No, the Sony Xperia T3 comes with a 2500mAh non-removable battery.
4. Does it work with Reliance Jio Network?
Ans: No, it doesn’t works with Reliance Jio Network.
5. What is the thickness of this phone?: Ans: Sony Xperia T3 is very slim device with only 5.3mm thickness and has a unibody construction.

Overview: The younger sibling of the HTC One X, the One V is also armed with an Android 4.0 ICS operating system and the HTC Sense UI. It has a 3.7 inch display, with a curved chin design which has been an HTC trademark. The phone is built quite well thanks to its unibody construction with the use of aluminium and feels quite premium for a handset in its price-range. Also, it has 4GB internal memory (with a microSD slot for expansion) and 512MB RAM. It also has a 5MP camera with a quick one second camera start up, can also shoot HD videos, and rich sound quality thanks to Beats Audio. The HTC One V, also of the One series, is more conveniently priced than the HTC One X. In October 2012, HTC rolled out Android 4.1 (Jellybean) upgrade for the One V. The One V is replaced by the Desire X which brings in a dual-core processor, more RAM (768MB) and a removable battery.

The S850 is a smartphone from the Chinese manufacturer Lenovo. The phone is well designed and sleek, 8.2mm to be precise. The device has an all glass exterior and has multi colour options. It has a 5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and the pixel density is around 294 PPI. Though its not the best screen out there its still good enough for the price. The phone has a 1.3GHz Quad-core processor and has 1GB of RAM. The processor and RAM combo could have been better as Lenovo offers the same in a cheaper phone.

The S850 has 16GB of internal storage but this is non expandable due to the lack of a microSD card. Lenovo has offered better cameras on the device, The back has a 13 megapixel autofocus camera with flash capable of 1080p video recording. There is a 5 megapixel wide angle camera at the front which is fixed focus. The phone runs Android Kitkat (4.4.2) with some customizations from Lenovo. It is a dual SIM device and has a non removable 2000 mAh battery which might have been compromised to keep the device sleek.
Panasonic Eluga U2 is the companys mid-range offering. It has gotten most of its looks from its predecessors. It has good specifications and it closely competes with the likes of HTC Desire 510.
Lets have a look at its offerings:

It runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box and its the first Panasonic device to do so. It will also have the Panasonics Fit Home UI running on top of it, but since its Android, you can switch to another launcher of choice.
It is powered by a 64 bit Snapdragon 410 processor which offers fast performance. Coupled with 2GB RAM, one can expect a lag free experience out of this device.
It has a 13MP rear camera which would shoot sharp images and it also records 1080p videos. The front camera is a 5 megapixels which is good enough for selfies.

It has a 5 IPS OGS panel. What it means is that the display is very close to the protecting glass which gives more realistic feel. A pixel density of 294PPI makes it better for reading text on this phone.

Internal memory of 16GB is present on this device out of which 11GB is user available. You can attain more internal space by removing the bloatware or by making use of the expandable microSD card slot to upto 32GB.
The battery on the Eluga U2 is rated at 2500mAh which will be sufficient for one working day usage.
Alternatives:
HTC Desire 816G Dual Sim
Lenovo Vibe X2
Samsung Galaxy E5

Introduction:: The iberry Auxus 4X is the first unibody premium smartphone in India with a 4GB RAM. It was launched in August 2016. The phone also has a low temperature poly-silicon display with High Color Gamut which is a highlight of the device.
Display and Design:: iberry Auxus 4X has a 5.5 inches full HD LCD display and has a screen resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels. It offers 440PPI pixel density and is available in Black colour. It has a dimension of 148.4 x 74.2 x 7.3 and it weighs 143 grams. The phone has sides made of metal and has a stylish look with 178 degree viewing angle. The back panel of the phone is made of anti-scratch rugged rubber and front is protected with Dragontrail Glass Protector. The screen has a 95% high color gamut.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device has a 2GHz octa-core Helio P10 processor, 4GB RAM and Android 6 Marshmallow Operating System. Its ARM Mali-T860 MP2 GPU provides an excellent gaming experience. It has proximity sensor, accelerometer, and ambient light sensor. The phone comes with FM and a 3.5 mm audio jack.
Camera and Storage:: It has a 13MP rear camera with a dual LED flash and 5MP front camera. Other advanced features in the phone include digital zoom, autofocus, touch focus, face detection and HDR.
Battery and connectivity:: This smartphone comes with a 3000mAh non-removable battery that lets the users enjoy 64 hours of continuous music, 18 hours of video and 13 hours of gaming sessions.

Overview: XOLO Play is a lower mid-range Android handset with a focus on Gaming. It has a 4.7-inch 1280 x 720 pixel IPS panel and an NVIDIA Tegra 3 chipset. With four cores running at 1.5GHz, a GeForce ULP GPU and 1GB RAM, this phone sports the same power as popular products like the HTC One X or the first version of the Nexus 7. But for a phone on which you'd expect to load intensive 3D games, the internal memory is seemingly less at 4GB, out of which roughly close to half should be available to the user. Nonetheless, there's a microSD card slot that supports up to 32GB (but remember, not all games can be transferred to external memory). NVIDIA's 'Tegra Zone' showcases games that are optimised to work best with this chipset. The XOLO Play supports 3G speeds of 21Mbps and WiFi 802.11n.

Multimedia highlights of this phone include an 8 megapixel camera at the back, that does 1080p HD video recording (thanks to the Tegra 3 chip). There's also a 2MP camera up-front. Providing juice to all this hardware is a 2000mAh Lithium ion battery.

Samsung's upcoming mid-range smartphone Samsung Galaxy A23, from its A-series lineup, seems to be nearing its launch. The smartphone will pack in some pretty decent specs. Speaking of which, we will get to see a decent display, a huge 5100mAh battery, average cameras, and will be powered by the Samsung Exynos 7 Octa 7884 SoC.
Design and Display: The Samsung Galaxy A23 will reportedly feature a 6.5 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a pixel density of 270ppi. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive punch-hole design and an aspect ratio of 20:9.
Cameras: The Samsung Galaxy A23 is expected to house a quad rear camera with a 16MP wide-angle primary sensor, an 8MP wide-angle sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 13MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features like Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Samsung Galaxy A23 will come baked with the Samsung Exynos 7 Octa 7884 chipset coupled with a Mali-G71 MP2GPU. The device will come with 4GB RAM and an internal storage capacity of 64GB, which can be expanded up to 512GB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 5100mAh Li-Polymer battery with fast charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Samsung Galaxy A23 will run Android 11 out of the box. Speaking of connectivity, the smartphone will support 5G, dual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.2. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a 3.5mm headphone jack, a USB Type-C port, and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Pros: Good display and good design
Large 5100mAh battery and fast charging
USB type-C port and fingerprint sensor
3.5mm headphone jack

Overview: HTC, has been doing decent in the mid-range category, it fills the space where an individual is looking for a mid range smartphone but also cares about the brand. HTC is said to have the maximum number of devices in the price range of 10,000 to 20,000, the HTC Desire 728 being on of them.
Display and Design: Display on the HTC Desire 728 is a 5.5 inch LCD Panel with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels (HD) giving it a pixel density of 267PPI. Unfortunately, this time we do not get Gorilla Glass protection over the display. The phone has a Plastic body construction but the build quality looks robust with solid colour options viz. White an Purple.
Hardware Specifications and Other Featur: Talking about the performance, the HTC Desire 728 runs on a MediaTek MT6753 Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and paired with it is 2GB of RAM which is bare minimum for a decent multitasking experience. In terms of software the phone runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box with HTC's Sense UI running on top of it. HTC Desire 728 also features HTC BoomSound with Dolby Audio for rich audio experience.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of the device sits a 13MP sensor that can record videos up to 1080p, whereas on the front you get a 5MP shooter for selfies and video calling. The rear camera also has an LED Flash for taking shots in the dark. And to store all your pictures and other data you get 16GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 2TB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power all this we have a 2800mAh battery that is non-removable which sounds decent enough to last through the day. The device supports Dual SIM GSM+GSM setup and takes Nano SIM only. The device also supports 4G connectivity.
Competition: In the similar price range there are other quite a few new entires that rock the latest chipset and are said to have a better camera with some other improvement features as well. The Moto G4 Plus being a decent performer with good camera, fingerprint sensor and also sports near stock Android experience. Latest entry to the list is Xiaomi Mi Max with a massive 6/44 inch display with top notch specs and performance.
